str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Prop: I fasten to; I lay hold of, touch, know carnally. Reflexive of hapto; properly, to attach oneself to, i.e. To touch.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
